### Membership

Become a Member of the Beth Sholom Preservation Foundation and help ensure the future of this Frank Lloyd Wright masterpiece of modern design and our shared cultural heritage.

**Membership Levels**

**Student ($35)** Admission for one student for one year with valid ID

**Individual ($50)** Admission for one member for one year, 10% discount in Design Store

**Household ($75)** Admission for up to 2 adults and 2 children, 10% discount in Design Store

**Aluminum Society ($150)** Household plus 2 additional adults, 2 guest passes

**Steel Society ($250)** Aluminum plus Membership in [North American Reciprocal Museum (NARM)](https://narmassociation.org/), [Reciprocal Organization of Associated Museums (ROAM)](https://sites.google.com/site/roammuseums/home/list-of-roam-museums) & [FLW National Reciprocal Sites Membership](https://flwright.org/sites/default/files/2023-03/FLW_RECIPROCAL_web_2023.pdf)

**Glass Society ($500)** Steel plus, special gift from the Design Store, Free Household membership to give as gift

[ Join ](https://bethsholompreservation.square.site/product/membership/2DZFMUZKSXSIF3VRFGO23TNU?cs=true&cst=custom)

## Beth Sholom

A National Historic Landmark Designed by Frank Lloyd Wright

## An Aerial Experience

Experience Frank Lloyd Wright’s only synagogue like never before. Take a breathtaking aerial journey over and inside the iconic Beth Sholom Synagogue with our new special drone video — showcasing its stunning design, dramatic geometry, and architectural brilliance from an entirely new perspective.

## Exclusive Tour Feature

#### The Story of Beth Sholom

Available only during guided tours, this captivating documentary brings to life the extraordinary journey behind Beth Sholom Synagogue. From the visionary dream of Rabbi Mortimer Cohen to the bold, modern design by legendary architect Frank Lloyd Wright, the film reveals how a groundbreaking idea became a spiritual and architectural landmark. Witness the full story unfold in our Visitor Center as part of your tour experience.

[**Learn More About Guided Tours**](/guided-tours)

## Digital Guide 

**Amplify your visit with Bloomberg Connects**

To make the experience of visiting the building easier, Beth Sholom Preservation Foundation has partnered with Bloomberg Connects, a free app with guides to more than two hundred museums and cultural spaces around the world. Download the app and amplify your visit with information and details about the building, such as photos and audio. Learn how the relationship between Rabbi Mortimer J. Cohen and Frank Lloyd Wright built this National Historic Building.
